addPatternToastErrorTitle: An error has occurred creating the pattern
addPatternToastSuccessDescription: The {{ name }} pattern has been created
addPatternErrorMaxLength: Please enter a maximum of {{max}} characters
addPatternErrorMin: Please enter a number greater than or equal to {{min}}
addPatternErrorMax: Please enter a number less than or equal to {{max}}
addPatternErrorPositive: Enter a number greater than or equal to zero
addPatternDescription1: Here you can use an encompassing correspondence model, i.e. logs_foo for the oldest indexes you want to delete as soon as the number of indexes exceeds this threshold. Please note that setting this model to 0 means that it will not be evaluated.
addPatternDescription2: This system can be very useful when, for example, OpenSearch is used to store logs and an index is created once a day. With this usage, you can then define how many days of logs you want to keep.
addPatternDescriptionExemple1: <anchor>"logs"</anchor> will correspond to the <anchor>"logs"</anchor> index, but not <anchor>"logsfoo"</anchor> or <anchor>"foologs"</anchor>
addPatternDescriptionExemple2: <anchor>"logs*"</anchor> will correspond to the <anchor>"logsfoo"</anchor> and <anchor>"logs_foo_bar"</anchor> indexes, but not <anchor>"foologs"</anchor>
addPatternDescriptionExemple3: <anchor>"*_logs_*"</anchor> will correspond to the <anchor>"foo_logs_bar"</anchor> index, but not <anchor>"foologsbar"</anchor>
addPatternDescriptionExemple4: <anchor>"logs.?"</anchor> will correspond to the <anchor>"logs.1"</anchor> index, but not <anchor>"logs.11"</anchor>
deletePatternDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the {{name}} pattern?
deletePatternToastErrorTitle: An error has occurred deleting the pattern
deleteIndexDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the {{name}} index?
deleteIndexToastErrorTitle: An error has occurred deleting the index
